{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is presenting with well-defined bald patches with no scarring, which is a characteristic feature of alopecia areata. Androgenetic alopecia usually presents with a receding hairline and thinning of hair on the crown, which is not the case here. Anagen effluvium and Telogen effluvium usually present with diffuse hair loss, not well-defined patches.", "answer_choice": "B. Alopecia areata"}
